title: Kalista in ARAM
body:
Every game (of ARAM) I play with a {{champion:429}} on my team, they bind me. Never (ever, ever) do they ask first. Then 99% of the time, they use it wrong.
Why is there no option to decline the bind? So many people just use it to troll their own teammates.

I tell them to just not ult me (because they can't do it right), but they keep fucking up my game.

I will now insta-afk every game that a Kalista binds me without asking, and I'll get punished for it.

Rito plz.

replies.body:
Maybe they know you. Maybe they've heard of you. Who knows?

But in all seriousness, you should be able to "decline" the bind by simply walking out of range while they're casting it, or better yet, some kind of "toggle" option for it so you can prevent them from trying to bind you in the first place.

> [{quoted}](name=HeartVine,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=4AUeklUq,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2018-05-14T08:38:21.084+0000)
>
> Maybe they know you. Maybe they've heard of you. Who knows?
> 
> But in all seriousness, you should be able to "decline" the bind by simply walking out of range while they're casting it, or better yet, some kind of "toggle" option for it so you can prevent them from trying to bind you in the first place.

I'm not famous, no one knows me.
No matter who I'm playing as, every Kalista on my team _always_ binds **me** and _never_ asks first. It is very rare to find a Kalista player who actually knows how to ult well, when you play ARAM games (it may be a different story for Kali mains on SR).

Honestly, whenever I *do* get Kalista, I *always* ask who wants to bind first. Like, I normally suck at using the ult anyway, so I tend to leave it for pulling them out of a bad situation, and letting them decide when to "re-enter". Would be nice if people took an approach a bit more like that, but that doesn't mean Riot couldn't implement a "simple" feature that allows players to "decline" the bind on their own (such as walking away), as that would help address the base issue.

But yeh, I find that most people who end up with Kalista simple don't care whether someone else wants to bind or not, and they pretty much just ult when they can and not when they should.

> [{quoted}](name=HeartVine,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=4AUeklUq,comment-id=000300000000,timestamp=2018-05-15T03:42:05.413+0000)
>
> Honestly, whenever I *do* get Kalista, I *always* ask who wants to bind first. Like, I normally suck at using the ult anyway, so I tend to leave it for pulling them out of a bad situation, and letting them decide when to "re-enter". 

You're the only one, I wish more people were like you.
But yeah, it should be a simple edit by Riot to decline the bind.

{{champion:429}} I never ask who to bind, I always bind the tank or the best engage.

I'll use it to help them disengage, initiate team fights, to allow them to chase that last low health enemy(s) or pull them quickly to lane.

Few exceptions - If {{champion:30}} Karthus or {{champion:14}} Sion is on my team I'll 100% pick them, as you can ult their death animation and allow them to do that little bit extra; plus no one expects it.

I don't think you should be able to cancel the binding as it's core to {{champion:429}} Kalista and would make her less enjoyable, but I do think it should be disabled while using certain abilities such as Morgana's R.

> [{quoted}](name=itsjustmattyo,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=4AUeklUq,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2018-05-18T01:42:02.142+0000)
>
> {{champion:429}} I never ask who to bind, I always bind the tank or the best engage.
> 
> I'll use it to help them disengage, initiate team fights, to allow them to chase that last low health enemy(s) or pull them quickly to lane.
> 
> Few exceptions - If {{champion:30}} Karthus or {{champion:14}} Sion is on my team I'll 100% pick them, as you can ult their death animation and allow them to do that little bit extra; plus no one expects it.
> 
> I don't think you should be able to cancel the binding as it's core to {{champion:429}} Kalista and would make her less enjoyable, but I do think it should be disabled while using certain abilities such as Morgana's R.

I think you misunderstand.
I'm saying you should be able to decline the bind, so she can pick someone else (at least in ARAM).

> [{quoted}](name=QAPLA,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=4AUeklUq,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2018-05-21T08:28:15.509+0000)
>
> I think you misunderstand.
> I'm saying you should be able to decline the bind, so she can pick someone else (at least in ARAM).

I understood that, I was saying I don't think you should be able to. It's core to Kalista's kit. Imagine if everyone canceled/declined? When used correctly it can improve your teams strength greatly - it's just some people troll with it. 

{{champion:429}}

What prompted this thread was me playing {{champion:25}} , hitting level 6, flashing into the middle of the enemy team and hitting R...
Instantly {{champion:429}} ults to pull me away from them all, removing 4 enemy champs from my ult AoE. Troll as fuck.

I then said to her "do that again and I'll AFK", and "just don't ult me at all". She did, so I did.

She also picked up enemy {{champion:26}} bombs and ran at members of our team on low health to try and kill them. Like I said, troll as fuck.
If your just going to afk why not just dodge

> [{quoted}](name=LAKIGR,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=4AUeklUq,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-05-14T05:43:55.074+0000)
>
> If your just going to afk why not just dodge

Because there are 3 other players to choose from.
This is ARAM, not bot lane.

I had always thought you could decline the spear just by walking away after the initial offer _(the paralysis is only temporary)_, and not clicking on the spear.

But i'm usually on the _other_ end of the oath. 
And on the odd occasion I play with a Kalista that isn't me, i've never tried to decline it, because it pretty much cuts her power in half _(remember its not just her ult, its her W passives too)_, and I wouldn't want to do that to my ADC.
